topic.title: HPE Helion OpenStack 1.0: Mapping Backend to Volume Type

body.p: You can use the newly added Cinder backend, create volume type and associate it with this backend using the Horizon Overcloud dashboard or Cinder CLI. The following sections explains how to create Volume Type and map to a given backend for Cinder using Overcloud Horizon dashboard.
The page covers the following tasks:

p.xref: Associate the volume type to a backend

section.title: Before you begin
section.p: Before you start working with volume types, ensure that the following prerequisites have been fulfilled:

li.p: Cloud is created and is created and the Cinder service is up and running

section.title: Create Volume type
section.p: To create a volume type using Overcloud dashboard, do the following:

li.p: Login to Overcloud Horizon dashboard. The Overcloud dashboard displays with the options in the left panel.
From the left panel, click the Admin Tab and then click Volumes to display the Volumes page.
Click Create Volume Type to display a dialog box.
Enter the name of the volume type.
Click Create Volume Type.The newly created volue displays in the Volumes page.

section.title: Associate the volume type to a backend
section.p: To map a volume type to a backend, do the following:

li.p: Login to Overcloud Horizon dashboard. The Overcloud dashboard displays with the options in the left panel.
From the left panel, click the Admin Tab and then click Volumes to display the Volumes page.
Click View Extra Specs displayed against the volume type which you want to associate to the backend. Create Volume Type Extra Specs dialog box is displayed.
Create Volume Type Extra Specs Dialog Box
In the Key box, enter the name of the key of the backend to which you want to associate the volume type. For example:volume_backend_name.
In the Value box, enter the name of the backend to which you want to associate the volume type.For example:FC_backend01.
Click Create to create the extra volume type specs.

section.p: Note: Once the volume type are mapped to the backends, the cloud user can create volumes.
